0.user_question: Steve loves playing video games.  His parents get him a console along with 5 games for his birthday.  He saves up enough money to buy 1 game per month for a year, and then the following year he starts buying 2 games a month.  For the third year he buys 4 games a month as he has a new part-time job that makes him more money.  He also gets 5 games for Christmas every year.  How many games does Steve have after 3 years?

ost_step.1: Identify the initial number of games Steve has. He has 5 games.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Steve started with 5 games. 1 game/month means he spends 5 + 1 = 6 dollars per month. Steve saves 8 - 6 = 2 dollars per month. So in total, he spends 2 * 5 = 10 dollars a month. After 1 year, he has 10 x 12 = 120 games. In 2 years, he has 120 x 2 = 240 games. 240 games are 240 * 3 = 720 games. In 3 years, he has 720 x 4 = 3120 games. 3120 games are 3120 * 5 = 15600 games. After the 5 games, he has 15600 - 12000 = 36 games. The answer is: 36.
